data.title: Add option to always show directories in filesystem dock
data.body: Adds a new simple editor setting to always show directories in the filesystem dock alongside files even when not in split_mode. May be more convenient and easier to navigate for some users.

data.title: Opening project now opens 3D view every time (even in 2D scene)
data.body:
Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Godot 3.0 master

Since recently Godot opens a project with a startup 2D scene in 3D view.
Earlier versions from 1-2 weeks ago did not show this behavior.

data.title: Problems encountered with WebAssembly export
data.body:
**Godot Version:** 3.0 master

Problems encountered with WebAssemply export. Keep getting following error message: 

ERROR: failed to asynchronously prepare wasm: TypeError: Failed to fetch
TypeError: Failed to fetch
ERROR: TypeError: Failed to fetch

Also issues when tried to run file from local repository using the 'run in browser button'. 

Is there a problem with the WebAssembly exporter?

data.title: Node "Change Type" from TextureFrame to Button - Button ignores mouse
data.body:
Godot 2.1.4 stable
Kubuntu

Steps:
1.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/30336814-956694b2-97e6-11e7-80a8-4dd1414d7b4b.png)
2. Right click "change type" to Button
3. Run project see that button is not clickable

TextureFrame
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/30336907-f2da4d46-97e6-11e7-9846-8db26b0e1404.png)

After "Change Type" the ignore mouse setting from TextureFrame is still there(Default in TextureFrame)

data.title: Node "Change Type" not working because nothing is selected
data.body:
Godot2.1.4 stable(I think I had the same issue on master)
Kubuntu 17.04

It looks like there are 2 type of selections 

In this case the Node is selected and change type works fine
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/30336528-baa96534-97e5-11e7-814d-9e1a0f012d96.png)

and in this case when you right click on the node it is not selecting the Node correctly so "Change Type" will have no effect.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4741886/30336543-c7bae2de-97e5-11e7-8c58-5cba08af3685.png)

Steps:
1. Select Node(Left click)
2. Run project
3. Stop Project
4. Right Click on Node "Change Type"
5. Choose new Type
6. See Node didn't change.

data.title: Translation csv reimport causes segfault when run from command line
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 (e8ad604865ddd09dd4c30f60854db7c411d66528), macOS Sierra 10.12.6

**Issue description:**
When exporting project from command line, translation.csv reimport causes weird behaviour (export loop followed by segfault) afterwards, as if the memory got corrupted. There is no segfault when reimport is done when you open the project in the editor without immediately exporting.

**Steps to reproduce:**

```bash
git clone -b translation-bug https://github.com/endragor/etc2bug.git translationbug
cd translationbug
godot --export Android test.apk
```

data.title: Move global constants to enums
data.body:
**Godot version:**
3.0 - master

**Issue description:**
Various input methods rely on values like `BUTTON_XY`, for mouse buttons or `JOY_BUTTON_XY`, for gamepad buttons. Currently they are constants in the global scope and methods using them take `int` parameters.
Now that we have proper enum support, it would be nice to move them to named enums.

data.title: Box selection for MeshInstances and subscene nodes.
data.body: Like the select ray improvements, this PR allows you to use box selection to select multiple MeshInstance nodes as well as nodes which are part of an instanced subscene. More consistency and further improvements to the 3D editor.

I would like to ask whether the tooltips in project settings can be modified or not. I would like to add some simple description for the properties. If not, I may carry this discussion to the godot documentation and try to create a page about the settings.

data.title: Fix box selection to in canvas and spatial editor.
data.body: Fixes bug with the box selection where rendered box's shape gets inverted if you move the cursor left or above its origin point.

data.title: Return move_to method to KinematicBody2D in Godot 3.0
data.body: This method is now not available in Godot 3.0, replacing this method with move(end_pos-init_pos) involve overhead in scripting system that previously was supported by c ++, from 1 API call in move_to, we have now 2 API call (move and get_position) an one aritmetic subtraction.

data.title: api_generator generates not all enums
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0, master branch

**Issue description:**
You should run engine with --gdnative-generate-json-api flag
In output api.json file you can see, that type GeometryInstance does not have any enums
In engine sources in file visual_instance.h declared two enums Flags and ShadowCastingSetting

api_generator.cpp tries to get enums from ClassDB::get_enum_list, but it does not contain these enums

**Types with this issue:**
AnimationTreePlayer, Area, Area2D, Mesh, AudioEffectFilter, AudioEffectDistortion, AudioServer, AudioStreamPlayer, AudioStreamSample, CollisionPolygon2D, Curve, EditorFileDialog, ImageTexture, Light2D

**Additional info:**
There is one more problem.
enums LineTextureMode, LineCapMode, LineJointMode defined in namespace, but not in class Line2D. But somehow in api.json they appears in Line2D class, but in other places, where is usage of these enums they looks like enum.LineTextureMode and not like enum.Line2D::LineTextureMode

data.title: Duplicate code for node duplications
data.body:
<sub>_\<!-- not using regular template, as this is about the code quality --\>_</sub>
**Godot version:** ebee989 (master)

While coding #11167, it became apparent that there are 3 or more functions with nearly-equivalent code which just duplicate nodes. We should review them, and centralise them if possible.

For clarity, those are the functions found so far:
* Node::_duplicate()
* Node::_duplicate_and_reown()
* SceneTreeDock::_duplicate()

data.title: Update TileMap class ref.
data.body: Add member variable descriptions. Ignoring get/set methods for now.

data.title: Expose CanvasItemEditor.snap_point() and CanvasItemEditor.snap_angle() to GDscript to use in EditorPlugins.
data.body: I would like to make an EditorPlugin that has draggable points that snap to the 2d canvas grid. Plugins like [Path2DEditor](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/9e0fbb49c12a4bb12c275194b0599fdfa0b1aabf/editor/plugins/path_2d_editor_plugin.cpp#L81), [CollisionPolygon2DEditor](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/fbda0cc45c2f50b9b30175c4f2398b8a73d7bf4a/editor/plugins/collision_polygon_2d_editor_plugin.cpp#L109), [Line2DEditor](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/dac150108ab3c1f41d5fd86cc6853f883064caaf/editor/plugins/line_2d_editor_plugin.cpp#L59), ect, all use CanvasItemEditor.snap_point() to snap to the grid. I don't think there is a good way to even get the snap settings alone in gdscript. Right now I use `get_editor_interface().get_base_control()`, then I recursively search through all the child nodes to find the SnapDialog and the MenuButton with "Edit" text. Then I read all the snap settings directly from the UI so I can make my own snap_point(). Would be very convenient if these functions were available in some way to GDscript.

data.title: Cache WebAssembly module
data.body:
The compiled WebAssembly module can be cached per IndexedDB to save time during start-up. The relevant code is here: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c78739adab54097edd7aeda706c7ef4423717f88/platform/javascript/engine.js#L239-L245
MDN has an article on this: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/WebAssembly/Caching_modules

data.title: Unable to run or build Godot 2.1.4 on Debian 10 Testing
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Debian 10 Testing, 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Can't start a Godot project (crashes on launching editor) building doesn't work either

**Steps to reproduce:**
Install Debian 10, try to run a project in Godot

**Copy pasted from my Reddit post**
Hi there, it seems I've missed something. I know that SSL is an issue with Debian 9+ but the fix seemed to be compiling my own with `builtin-openssl=yes` however that isn't working now. 

I do have a fresh install of Debian 10 though, so I could be missing dependancies. I have used the 1 liner command to get them all I believe however. 

If I use the command `scons platform=x11 target=release_debug bits=64 use_llvm=yes builtin_openssl=yes` which has previously worked for me (on the Raspberry Pi version for Debian 9) I get this error: https://pastebin.com/bvEnKwt7

I do have `xrandr` installed though as I am able to use the command `xrandr`. My current config is Budgie DE on Debian Testing. Everything is fully updated.

data.title: Exposing more editor-features and -plugins to EditorPlugin
data.body:
Hey! After trying and somewhat failing to achieve some editor-customizations with the EditorPlugin and tools scripts (mainly with [tilemaps ](https://godotengine.org/qa/17659/tool-mode-possible-notified-tilemap-cell-was-changed-editor)) I dabbled a little with Unity and had a look at its very nice editor extensibility. You can look at the official [API](https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/SceneManagement.EditorSceneManager.html) and some presentations of [cool](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sNVT7hynBYw) and [useful](https://youtu.be/s1o0gZwJS-4) extensions some gamedevs wrote on youtube to get an idea of its possibilities.

I want to ask if it is possible to expose more of the API of the editor to achieve similar things in Godot. Some examples of what would be cool to access from GDScript:
- Inspector for custom formatting and input of node properties (i.e. float-ranges, arrays of strings as 
  comma separated string, drop-downs for Enums and custom types, etc.)
- Main viewport for easier drawing of gizmos and debugstuff from a plugin and manipulation of position
  and orientation of the camera. I know you can get the viewport from the EditorPlugin but drawing did 
  not really work for me due to me having coordinate system issues. Drawing from a tool node on the 
  other hand worked without a flaw. 
- TileMapEditor plugin for receiving events of cell filling for doing things like autotiling or doing custom 
  patterns
- ScriptEditor for custom refactoring, code generation and annotation tools
- AnimationPlayerEditor plugin for various visualizations and annotations
- Opening, closing, saving and editing of scenes in background or loading multiple scenes in and out of 
  the current scene
- Selection and deselection of nodes that also notifies corresponding plugins (like closing/opening 
  the TileMapEditor when a TileMap node is deselected/selected **from code**)
etc.

I think this would be a huge benefit for the community, as the most important thing for productive gamedev is to have really good tools that are tailored to the game you are making or an easy way to build those on top of almost perfect tools.

data.title: gdnative-generate-json-api produces wrong json.api file
data.body:
If you run engine with --gdnative-generate-json-api flag it produces api.json file
And it contains this:
`"return_type": "enum.Error",`

that fails compilation of header file:
`class enum.Error;`
